section.name: Request headers
section.p:
Some request headers are forwarded to the target server, some are ignored and some are transformed. Here is the list of supported Request HTTP headers. Any other header would be ignored.
Request header Action
Accept Forwarded
Accept-Charset Forwarded
Accept-Encoding Forwarded
Accept-Language Forwarded
Accept-Ranges Ignored (Ranges not supported)
Authorization
Default ignored, see authentication
Cache-control
See Cache
Expect Replies with a 417 (Expectation Failed)
From Forwarded
Host Default ignored, depends on preserveHost parameter
If-Match Ignored
If-Modified-Since
See Cache
If-None-Match
See Cache
If-Range Ignored (Ranges not supported)
If-Unmodified-Since Ignored
Max-Forwards Ignored
Pragma
See Cache
Proxy-Authorization Ignored
Range Ignored (Ranges not supported)
Referer Rewritten
TE Ignored (chunked encoding managed by the container)
Upgrade Ignored
User-Agent Forwarded

section.name: Response headers
section.p:
Some of the response headers sent by the target servers are forwarded to the browser, some are ignored, some are transformed and some are used for Cache management. Any header not in the following list would be ignored.
Response header Action
Age
See Cache
Allow Forwarded
Cache-control
See Cache
Connection Ignored (keep-alive managed by the servlet container)
Content-Disposition Forwarded
Content-Encoding Forwarded only for unparsed responses
Content-Language Forwarded
Content-Length Recalculated and sent in the response
Content-Location Rewritten
Content-MD5 Ignored
Content-Range Ignored
Content-Type Forwarded
Date Forwarded
Expires
See Cache
E-tag
See Cache
Last-modified
See Cache
Location Rewritten
Proxy-Authenticate
Default ignored, see authentication
Retry-After Forwarded
Server Ignored (managed by the container)
Trailer Ignored (chunked encoding managed by the container)
Transfer-Encoding Ignored (chunked encoding managed by the container)
Vary
See Cache
Via Forwarded
Warning Forwarded
WWW-Authenticate
Default ignored, see authentication
